Direct Known Subclasses:
IntroWiki
public class Wiki extends Merge implements InsertionInterface<Comparable>
Wiki Sort, also known as Block Merge Sort, is an efficient comparison-based sorting algorithm designed to improve upon the performance. Wiki Sort is a stable sorting algorithm, meaning that it preserves the relative order of elements with equal values. It achieves a time complexity of O(n log(n)) in the worst case.
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Wiki

      public Wiki()
      Wiki Sort:
      Also known as Block Merge Sort, is an efficient comparison-based sorting algorithm designed to improve upon the performance. Wiki Sort is a stable sorting algorithm, meaning that it preserves the relative order of elements with equal values. It achieves a time complexity of O(n log(n)) in the worst case.

      The key idea behind Wiki Sort is to use a divide-and-conquer approach to sort the array. It divides the array into blocks of elements and sorts each block independently. Then it repeatedly merges the blocks together until the entire array is sorted.

      Example:
      1. Divide the input array into blocks of a fixed size (often chosen based on the cache size or other hardware considerations).
      2. Sort each block individually using an efficient sorting algorithm, such as Insertion Sort or another divide-and-conquer algorithm.
      3. Merge adjacent pairs of blocks together, repeatedly merging until only one block remains.
      4. Perform a final merge pass to merge the remaining blocks until the entire array is sorted.
      Note:
      The merging process in Wiki Sort is where it differs from other sorting algorithms. It uses a clever technique called to efficiently merge the blocks together. Instead of comparing and merging individual elements, it works with entire blocks, reducing the number of comparisons and improving cache efficiency.

      Wiki Sort's performance benefits come from its ability to exploit the data locality of modern computer architectures. By dividing the array into blocks and sorting them independently, it minimizes data movement between levels of the memory hierarchy and takes advantage of cache locality.

      Wiki Sort is a highly efficient and practical sorting algorithm that offers better performance than some traditional sorting algorithms. Its design incorporates techniques to optimize cache usage and minimize the number of comparisons, making it particularly useful for sorting large arrays or datasets with repeated elements.

      Property:
      Worst Case Complexity: O(n log(n))
      Best Case Complexity: O(n log(n))
      Average Case Complexity: O(n log(n))
      Auxiliary Space: O(n)
      Stability: Yes
      See Also:
      • IntroDPQWiki
      • IntroWiki

    • wikiInc

      protected void wikiInc(Comparable[] array)
      wikiInc, is a helper function used in the Wiki Sort algorithm to sort a portion of the input array.
      • It assigns the value of array.length to the variable n.
      • It creates a new temporary array called buffer of size n to store the merged blocks during the merge operation.
      • The subsequent for loop divides the portion of the array into blocks of size WIKI_BLOCK and performs an incremental insertion sort on each block using the insertionInc method. The loop increments i by WIKI_BLOCK in each iteration to move to the next block.
        • Once all the blocks have been individually sorted, the mergeInc method is called to merge the blocks together using the temporary buffer array. The block size is specified as WIKI_BLOCK, and the range is from left to right.
      wikiInc method is to sort a portion of the input array using incremental insertion sort for small blocks and then perform the merging step using the mergeInc method. This process is a part of the overall Wiki Sort algorithm, which involves dividing the array into blocks, sorting the blocks, and then merging them to obtain the final sorted array.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      See Also:
      • WIKI_BLOCK
      • InsertionInterface.insertionInc(Comparable[], int, int)
      • MergeInterface.mergeInc(Comparable[], int, int, int)

    • wikiDec

      protected void wikiDec(Comparable[] array)
      wikiDec, is a helper function used in the Wiki Sort algorithm to sort a portion of the input array.
      • It assigns the value of array.length to the variable n.
      • It creates a new temporary array called buffer of size n to store the merged blocks during the merge operation.
      • The subsequent for loop divides the portion of the array into blocks of size WIKI_BLOCK and performs an incremental insertion sort on each block using the insertionDec method. The loop increments i by WIKI_BLOCK in each iteration to move to the next block.
        • Once all the blocks have been individually sorted, the mergeDec method is called to merge the blocks together using the temporary buffer array. The block size is specified as WIKI_BLOCK, and the range is from left to right.
      wikiDec method is to sort a portion of the input array using incremental insertion sort for small blocks and then perform the merging step using the mergeDec method. This process is a part of the overall Wiki Sort algorithm, which involves dividing the array into blocks, sorting the blocks, and then merging them to obtain the final sorted array.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.

    • wikiInc

      protected void wikiInc(Comparable[] array, int left, int right)
      wikiInc, is a helper function used in the Wiki Sort algorithm to sort a portion of the input array.
      • It assigns the value of right (the index of the rightmost element in the current portion of the array being sorted) to the variable right.
      • It creates a new temporary array called buffer of size n to store the merged blocks during the merge operation.
      • The subsequent for loop divides the portion of the array into blocks of size WIKI_BLOCK and performs an incremental insertion sort on each block using the insertionInc method. The loop increments i by WIKI_BLOCK in each iteration to move to the next block.
        • Once all the blocks have been individually sorted, the mergeInc method is called to merge the blocks together using the temporary buffer array. The block size is specified as WIKI_BLOCK, and the range is from left to right.
      wikiInc method is to sort a portion of the input array using incremental insertion sort for small blocks and then perform the merging step using the mergeInc method. This process is a part of the overall Wiki Sort algorithm, which involves dividing the array into blocks, sorting the blocks, and then merging them to obtain the final sorted array.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      left - the value in the array must be smaller than a right parameter.
      right - the value in the array must be greater than a left parameter.
      See Also:
      • WIKI_BLOCK
      • InsertionInterface.insertionInc(Comparable[], int, int)
      • MergeInterface.mergeInc(Comparable[], int, int, int)

    • wikiDec

      protected void wikiDec(Comparable[] array, int left, int right)
      wikiDec, is a helper function used in the Wiki Sort algorithm to sort a portion of the input array.
      • It assigns the value of right (the index of the rightmost element in the current portion of the array being sorted) to the variable right.
      • It creates a new temporary array called buffer of size n to store the merged blocks during the merge operation.
      • The subsequent for loop divides the portion of the array into blocks of size WIKI_BLOCK and performs an incremental insertion sort on each block using the insertionDec method. The loop increments i by WIKI_BLOCK in each iteration to move to the next block.
        • Once all the blocks have been individually sorted, the mergeDec method is called to merge the blocks together using the temporary buffer array. The block size is specified as WIKI_BLOCK, and the range is from left to right.
      wikiDec method is to sort a portion of the input array using incremental insertion sort for small blocks and then perform the merging step using the mergeDec method. This process is a part of the overall Wiki Sort algorithm, which involves dividing the array into blocks, sorting the blocks, and then merging them to obtain the final sorted array.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      left - the value in the array must be smaller than a right parameter.
      right - the value in the array must be greater than a left parameter.
